unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Termites | 1 of 2
question_text:
Termites are starting to become a big problem in a large city.
Two different chemicals, chemicals A and B, are typically used to exterminate termites. Forty homes are treated with chemical A, and another forty are treated with chemical B. Forty homes are treated with a mixture of chemicals A and B, and another forty homes are treated with nothing (as a control group). Six months after the chemicals were used, the homes were examined to determine if all the termites were exterminated.
This information is represented in the table below:
Termites Exterminated Termites NOT Exterminated
Chemical A 28 12
Chemical B 27 13
Both Chemicals A and B 28 12
Neither Chemical (control) 7 33


Assume the homes were randomly selected and that each had a similar termite condition.
Use the table to determine if each of the four treatments are equally effective.

choices.text: Strong evidence exists that the four treatments are equally effective since $p < 0.0005$.
No strong evidence exists that the four treatments are equally effective since $p < 0.0005$.
Strong evidence exists that the four treatments are not equally effective since $p < 0.0005$.
Moderate evidence exists that the four treatments are not equally effective since p > $0.01$.
Since $p > 0.25$, no significant evidence exists of a difference between the four treatments.
